dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Warren Buffett Has $69.9 Billion Invested in This Dividend-Paying Stock. Is It a Buy Now?
News Content: There are many ways to get rich on Wall Street, but none seem as reliable as the strategies employed by Warren Buffett. The legendary investor took control of Berkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) in 1965. Over the past six decades, the stock has delivered a 19.6% average annual gain.

There aren't any secrets to Buffett's success. In addition to an annual shareholder meeting that can pack a stadium full of investors, Berkshire Hathaway reports its trading activity to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission every three months.

We can see from Berkshire's disclosures that it ended last September with 300 million Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) shares in its portfolio. Worth $69.9 billion at the time, the iPhone manufacturer made up 26% of the holding company's equity portfolio.

Apple is Berkshire Hathaway's largest holding, but it's a much smaller holding than it used to be. Berkshire reduced the number of Apple shares on its books by 25% in the third quarter of 2024, and it wasn't the first sale. Berkshire has reduced the size of its Apple stake by 66.5% since the end of 2022.

Why Buffett sold heaps of Apple shares

Buffett wouldn't keep Apple at the top of Berkshire's portfolio if he weren't confident about the business and its ability to steadily grow earnings over time. That said, selling off more than half of its stake is hardly an inspiring vote of confidence.

Berkshire's recent sales of Apple stock have more to do with the stock's stretched valuation than any concern about the business. The stock is trading for about 31.7 times trailing free cash flow. That's an appropriate price for a business with profits growing by a mid- to high-single-digit percentage, which is not an accurate description of Apple's performance in recent years.AAPL Free Cash Flow data by YCharts.

Trailing-12-month revenue has risen by 1.3% over the past three years. Apple's bottom line has outpaced its top line, but not by much. Free cash flow per share has risen 10.7% over the past three years and has been creeping higher, but only because Apple is repurchasing heaps of its own stock. Total free cash flow has risen only 2.9% over the past three years.

A mismatch between Apple's valuation and its recent performance puts it in a precarious situation. If the market finds a reason to get nervous about its yearslong earnings deceleration, the bottom could fall out from under the stock.

Why holding some Apple shares is still a good idea

Investors can think of free cash flow as earnings a company can use to pay dividends, reinvest, reduce debt, or repurchase stock. With $108.8 billion in free cash flow over the past 12 months, Apple can pull on a lot of different levers to keep earnings per share moving in the right direction over the long run.

Story Continues

Apple's device sales aren't growing very fast, but it is selling a growing array of services to its enormous user base. Last year, the company reported more than 2.2 billion active devices worldwide, and high-margin service sales to all those device holders are picking up.

Fiscal fourth-quarter service sales rose 12% year over year. Now, services are responsible for 26% of total revenue. While device sales will likely creep forward due to market saturation, plenty of those device holders haven't started subscriptions to iCloud Storage, Apple Music, or Apple TV+ yet. High-margin service sales could allow earnings to continue growing at a single-digit percentage for many years.

The bottom could fall out from under Apple's stock price the next time the stock market gets sad. Fortunately, it will take more than a bear market to slow Apple's steadily growing dividend payments. The stock offers a minuscule 0.4% dividend yield at recent prices, but it could safely raise it by leaps and bounds. Over the past 12 months, the company met its dividend commitment with just 14% of the free cash flow its operations generated.

Not time to buy

Apple is still the largest holding in Berkshire's equity portfolio, but that doesn't make it a good stock to buy now for most investors. There are plenty of good reasons to retain some shares of Apple in a well-diversified portfolio. Unfortunately, buying the richly valued stock while sales and profits appear nearly stagnant doesn't seem like a great idea.

Don’t miss this second chance at a potentially lucrative opportunity

Ever feel like you missed the boat in buying the most successful stocks? Then you’ll want to hear this.

On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a “Double Down” stock recommendation for companies that they think are about to pop. If you’re worried you’ve already missed your chance to invest, now is the best time to buy before it’s too late. And the numbers speak for themselves:

Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $369,816!* Apple: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2008, you’d have $42,191!* Netflix: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, you’d have $527,206!*

Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon.

Learn more »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 21, 2025

Cory Renauer has no position in any of the stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Warren Buffett Has $69.9 Billion Invested in This Dividend-Paying Stock. Is It a Buy Now? was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The analysis indicates that while Warren Buffett holds a significant stake in Apple, he has reduced his holdings considerably, leading to concerns about the stock's valuation. Apple's recent performance in terms of revenue growth is not strong, and there is a mismatch between its valuation and earnings potential. While the company has substantial free cash flow and a growing services segment, the overall sentiment appears cautious due to the stagnant growth and high valuation. Therefore, the probability of the stock price falling is assessed to be higher than rising.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The article presents a mixed outlook for Apple's stock. While Warren Buffett's large holding suggests confidence, Berkshire Hathaway has significantly reduced its stake, citing valuation concerns due to stagnant sales and profit growth. The article highlights Apple's strong free cash flow and growing services revenue as positives but concludes that the stock is not a buy now, primarily because of the rich valuation and stagnant sales which can lead to potential downfall of the stock. Berkshire already reduced the number of Apple shares on its books by 25% in the third quarter of 2024, and it wasn't the first sale. Berkshire has reduced the size of its Apple stake by 66.5% since the end of 2022. This leads to more potential of stock price falling. Overall, the negative sentiment outweighs the positive aspects and the high valuation leaves the stock vulnerable to downside risk. Also the ending promotion of the article is misleading and is not related to Apple.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article highlights Warren Buffett's significant reduction in Apple stock holdings, citing Apple's high valuation relative to its recent earnings growth.  While Apple's service sector is expanding, overall revenue growth remains sluggish.  The article concludes that Apple's current valuation is not justified, making it a less attractive buy.  Although a low dividend yield is mentioned, this is not a strong enough counter-argument to the primary concerns of overvaluation and slow growth. The mention of past successful investments by a certain named team does not factor into this analysis as it is anecdotal information presented for promotional reasons and lacks verifiable data to support its claims. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall outweighs the probability of a rise based on this news alone.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The article discusses Warren Buffett's substantial investment in Apple (AAPL) but highlights that Berkshire Hathaway has significantly reduced its stake in the company by 66.5% since 2022 due to concerns over Apple's stretched valuation and stagnant growth. While Apple's services segment shows promise with 12% year-over-year growth, its overall revenue and free cash flow growth are minimal (1.3% and 2.9% over three years, respectively). The stock's high valuation (31.7x trailing free cash flow) and slowing earnings growth pose risks. However, Apple's strong free cash flow and dividend potential provide some stability. Given the mixed signals—Buffett's reduced stake signaling caution but Apple's underlying financial strength—the stock price may face downward pressure in the short term due to valuation concerns.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's significant investment in Apple Inc. (AAPL) and his recent sales of the stock. While Buffett still holds a large stake in Apple, the reduction in his holdings and concerns about the stock's valuation suggest a cautious outlook. The article highlights that Apple's valuation is stretched, trading at 31.7 times trailing free cash flow, which is high given its recent performance. Revenue growth has been slow, with only a 1.3% increase over the past three years. However, the article also notes that Apple's service sales are growing, which could support long-term earnings growth. Overall, the news suggests a neutral to slightly negative outlook for Apple's stock price in the short term due to valuation concerns and slow growth.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's significant investment in Apple Inc. (AAPL) and analyzes whether it is a good time to buy the stock. The article highlights that Apple is Berkshire Hathaway's largest holding, but the stake has been reduced by 66.5% since 2022. The reason for the sale is attributed to the stock's stretched valuation rather than concerns about the business. The article notes that Apple's revenue and free cash flow growth have been slow, but the company has a strong track record of generating earnings and has a growing services segment. However, the stock's valuation is considered rich, and the article concludes that it may not be the best time to buy AAPL. Based on this analysis, the probability of the stock price rising is lower than the probability of it falling due to the stretched valuation and slow growth.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The financial news highlights mixed signals regarding Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, Warren Buffett, known for his strategic investment choices, retains a significant stake in Apple despite reducing his holdings. On the other hand, the article suggests that Apple's stock is overvalued relative to its recent financial performance, as evidenced by the slowing growth in both revenue and free cash flow. Additionally, the news indicates that further reduction in Apple's stake is partly due to the stock's valuation, rather than concerns about the underlying business. While Apple's services segment shows promising growth, the article cautions against purchasing the stock given its current valuation and perceived underperformance.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's substantial investment in Apple, but it also reveals significant reductions in his holdings due to concerns about the stock's high valuation relative to stagnant revenue growth. While Apple has a strong free cash flow and a growing services segment, the overall performance over recent years has been sluggish, and the market may react negatively to the current valuation levels. Given that multiple analyses indicate a consensus that the risks outweigh the rewards at this valuation, I predict a higher probability of the stock price falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The consensus from previous rounds leans towards a higher probability of the stock price falling, primarily due to concerns about Apple's stretched valuation and slowing growth. While Buffett maintains a substantial investment, his significant reduction in holdings signals caution. The article highlights stagnant revenue growth and a high price-to-free-cash-flow ratio, suggesting the current valuation may not be justified. Apple's growing services segment offers some positive potential, but it's insufficient to outweigh concerns about overvaluation and slowing growth. Considering the prior rounds' analysis and the provided information, I maintain a similar outlook with a slightly increased probability of a fall given the consistent negative sentiment.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While Warren Buffett's continued large holding suggests some confidence, the significant reduction in Berkshire Hathaway's stake due to valuation concerns is a significant negative.  Apple's slow revenue growth and high valuation relative to its earnings are major drawbacks. The positive is the growth in the services sector, offering potential for future growth. However, the current market sentiment, as reflected in Buffett's actions and the article's conclusion, leans towards caution.  Considering the previous predictions which are mostly leaning towards a fall, and the overall bearish sentiment driven by valuation concerns and sluggish growth, the probability of a price fall is higher than a rise, though the presence of a growing services sector mitigates the negativity somewhat. The promotional section at the end of the article is ignored as it is irrelevant to Apple's intrinsic value.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The financial news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). Warren Buffett's significant stake reduction (66.5% since 2022) signals caution, primarily due to Apple's stretched valuation (31.7x trailing free cash flow) and stagnant revenue growth (1.3% over three years). However, Apple's strong free cash flow ($108.8 billion) and growing services segment (12% YoY growth) provide some stability. The article concludes that AAPL is not a buy now due to its high valuation and slow growth, suggesting potential downside risk. Previous predictions from other models also lean towards a higher probability of the stock price falling (average 0.65) compared to rising (average 0.35). Given the valuation concerns and Buffett's reduced stake, the probability of a price decline is assessed to be higher.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's significant investment in Apple Inc. (AAPL) and his recent reduction in holdings. While Buffett still holds a large stake in Apple, the reduction and concerns about the stock's valuation suggest a cautious outlook. Apple's valuation is stretched, trading at 31.7 times trailing free cash flow, which is high given its recent performance. Revenue growth has been slow, with only a 1.3% increase over the past three years. However, Apple's service sales are growing, which could support long-term earnings growth. Considering the mixed signals—Buffett's reduced stake signaling caution but Apple's underlying financial strength—the stock price may face downward pressure in the short term due to valuation concerns. The consensus from various models suggests a higher probability of the stock price falling than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.32, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.68, Reasoning: The article discusses Warren Buffett's significant investment in Apple Inc. (AAPL) and his recent reduction in holdings due to concerns over the stock's valuation. While Apple's services segment shows promise, the overall revenue and free cash flow growth are slow, and the stock's valuation is considered high. The analysis concludes that the stock is not a good buy now, given its rich valuation and stagnant sales. Considering the concerns over valuation and slow growth, the probability of the stock price falling is estimated to be higher than the probability of it rising.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
